description: This header file provides utility functions within the Utils namespace for reading properties from files, reading file content, checking if a path is a regular file, searching files recursively with patterns, and expanding properties within strings. It is part of a larger codebase involving file handling and configuration parsing.

methods.name: bool readPropertyFromFile(const char * filename,const string & property,string & propertyValue)
methods.description: Reads a property value from a given file based on a property name, supporting recursive expansion if the value starts with '$'.

methods.name: bool readFileContent(const char * filename,string & content)
methods.description: Reads the entire content of a file into a provided string.

methods.name: bool isRegularFile(const string & path)
methods.description: Checks if a given path corresponds to a regular file.

methods.name: bool searchFilesRec(std::vector<std::string> & pathList,unsigned int currentDepth,const std::list<string> & exclusions,string & result)
methods.description: Recursively searches for files matching patterns with support for wildcards and exclusions, collecting up to 10 results.

methods.name: bool searchFiles(string & inputPath,int maxDepth,int minDepth,const std::list<string> & exclusions,string & result)
methods.description: Initiates a recursive search for files from a starting directory with specified depth and exclusions.

methods.name: bool ExpandPropertiesInString(const char * input,const char * filePath,string & expandedString)
methods.description: Expands variables within a string by replacing placeholders with property values read from a file.
